intro: Osmorhiza brevipes, commonly known as the shortfoot sweetroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is tuberous and often used in traditional medicine. Osmorhiza brevipes thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
